Headline: Temporary Reroute
ShortDescription: SB #34 and #119 buses will operate via Michigan, 115th, State, and 117th, then resume their normal route on Michigan.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Southbound #34 South Michigan and #119 Michigan/119th buses will operate via Michigan, 115th, State, and 117th, then resume their normal route on Michigan.

Northbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to construction at Michigan/115th.

Headline: Forest Park-bound Blue Line Delays
ShortDescription: Forest Park-bound Blue Line trains are running w/residual delays following an earlier sick customer at Jefferson Park. Service is resuming, allow extra time.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Forest Park-bound Blue Line trains are running w/residual delays following an earlier sick customer at Jefferson Park.

Trains are moving and normal service is being restored.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: 63rd-bound Green Line Service Delayed at Ashland
ShortDescription: 63rd-bound Green Line trains are standing at Ashland due to a sick customer. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
63rd-bound Green Line trains are standing at Ashland due to a sick customer.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Red Line Service Delayed at Grand
ShortDescription: Red Line trains are standing at Grand due to an unauthorized person on t he tracks. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Red Line trains are standing at Grand due to an unauthorized person on t he tracks.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to a sick customer at Ashland.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line service has been temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due a sick customer at Ashland.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Other possible alternatives may include:

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
